dialogue: I'm so sorry, Benji.
Yo, thank you Marcia, you're a sweetheart. And things have been kinda downhill fo r me. She was my favorite person in the world. Shit, I'm sorry.
People will eat you alive if you give them a fuckin inch.
Yo!
I don't know.
Marcia Marcia Marcia!   Your country needs you!
You're very persuasive, Benji.
I know! Give your phone to Davie, he's a great photographer.
You wanna work with Eloge on this dude's leg?
No, I'm a fighter.   Gimme a gun.
Ho ho ho!    Look at you!
Feeling what?
Just the creepy feeling of being, like, royalty on this train, you know? Does anyone not see the irony here?
Benji-
Yo.
"Yo."
I wanted to say that I've been thinking about what you said on the train. About understanding suffering. It really stirred me.
Yo, seriously Marcia?
Yes.
Dope.
You know, last year, my daughter married a very rich man-
-Oh fuck-
-And she can barely have a conversation with any depth anymore. She's lost any perspective on the real world.
Of course she has! Money's like fuckin heroin for boring people.
Well, I don't know what that means. But it's so easy to float through life, forgetting how lucky we are.
Exactly!
I think that's a lovely idea.
Thanks Marcia.
I did not, Benji.
Take one of mine.
That's very kind, than k you.
Mark and Diane place their stones down, followed by Eloge, James and David. It's all very somber and sweet.
You're gonna put it there?
Is there something wrong with where I'm putting it?
Everyone knows it's sacrilege to put a rock on the north side of a grave.
Well, that's fine because I'm an atheist.
Oooh, damn girl!

And my father's brother was the real brains of the family. He was rejected from medical school because of quotas, you know, on Jewish doctors or what have you. I'm sorry -- I'm just having trouble competing with Hava Nagila--
That's nice, Benji. If my kids call me once a month, it's a shock.

Oh, Marcia, I'm sorry, fuck them. I wouldn't miss a week. She was tough on me. She was the only one in the whole fuckin family who would keep me honest. Ev eryone else just disappeared when I needed them most.
Y ou're a very special person.
Shit, you too Marcia.
Oh, god, no I'm not. Anyway, you have my information. Send me a picture from your grandma's house. I'm genuinely curious.
